intro: Pimelea tinctoria, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs. Pimelea tinctoria is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of Australia.
